					 Info
					 BASF SE EU Transparency Register 7410939793-88 First registered on 16 Dec 2008 Goals / Remit At BASF, we create chemistry for a sustainable future. Our ambition: We want to be the preferred chemical company to enable our customers’ green transformation. We combine economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility. Around 112,000 employees in the BASF Group contribute to the success of our customers in nearly all sectors and almost every country in the world. Our portfolio comprises, as core businesses, the segments Chemicals, Materials, Industrial Solutions, and Nutrition & Care; our standalone businesses are bundled in the segments Surface Technologies and Agricultural Solutions. BASF generated sales of €65.3 billion in 2024. BASF shares are traded on the stock exchange in Frankfurt (BAS) and as American Depositary Receipts (BASFY) in the United States. Further information at www.basf.com. Main EU files targeted EU Green Deal, Circular Economy, Sustainable Finance, Energy & Climate Policy, Innovation & Research, Trade and Competition Policy, Health & Environmental Policy, Chemicals Policy, Construction, Crop Protection Policy, Biotechnology, Internal Market, Competitiveness, Industrial Policy, Social and Employment Policy Address Head Office Carl-Bosch-Str. 38 Ludwigshafen 67056 GERMANY EU Office Rue Marie de Bourgogne 58 Brussel 1000 BELGIUM Website

Complementary Information While BASF has 106 people engaged in activities falling under the Transparency Register, 41 of them spend significantly below 10 percent of their working time on activities covered by the scope of the Transparency Register. However, 10 percent is the minimum that can be chosen in the reporting system for each person involved from the organisation expressed in percentage of working time. This is why the Full time equivalent (FTE) should be below 25.6. BASF has excluded from the above calculation de minimis activity (less than 3% of total working time) undertaken by BASF employees, including executives or occasional experts. This declaration encompasses activities relevant to the Transparency Register incurred by BASF group entities beyond our headquarters and Brussels office, including in-house public affairs in EU27 countries. All information below comes from the Commission and not from the registrant. 1 July 2024: We have noted that some meetings are appearing in duplicate, ie. some meetings seem to be listed twice. This seems to be because the Commission changes some element of a meeting data after the meeting has first been listed, which causes LobbyFacts to register it as a new meeting.
